MATLAB code¶

src¶

src module contains some functions implementing Lie group time integrators

src.main()¶

Damped Spherical Pendulum solved with Lie groups time integrator

src.LieEuler¶

Lie Forward Euler time integrator

Parameters:

  • vector_field – right hand side of the ODE

  • action – action on the Lie group

  • expMap – exponential map from the Lie algebra to the Lie group

  • initial_condition – initial condition

  • h – time step size

Returns:

discrete trajectory

src.actionSE3¶

action on the SE3 group

Parameters:

  • A – element of the Lie group SE3

  • v – element of the Lie algebra se3

Returns:

element of the Lie algebra se3

src.expSE3¶

exponential map on the SE3 group

Parameters:

input – element of the Lie algebra se3

Returns:

element of the Lie group SE3

A function implements the Newton-Raphson algorithm for implicit methods:

src.NewtonRaphson¶

Newton-Raphson scheme to solve the dEL equations

Parameters:

  • residual – function to evaluate the RHS of the system

  • jacobian – iteration matrix

  • initial_condition – initial condition

  • h – time step size

  • max_it – maximum number of iterations

  • atol – absolute tolerance

  • rtol – relative tolerance

Returns:

discrete trajectory

The module further contains an example script and related functions:

src.fManiToAlgebra¶

RHS of the mathematical pendulum

Parameters:

  • y – generalized coordinates

  • damp – damping parameter

  • k – parameter

Returns:

vector field

src.initializeSE3¶

Initialization in SE3

Returns:

normalized verctor in R3

respective orthogonal vector (angular velocity) concatenation of the two

src.residualSE3¶

RHS of the system

Parameters:

  • v0 – initial condition

  • v – current configuration

  • h – time step size

  • f – vector field

  • action – action on the Lie group

  • method – numerical method in use

Returns:

RHS of the system

src.jacobianSE3¶

Jacobian of the system

Parameters:

  • v0 – initial condition

  • v – current configuration

  • h – time step size

  • f – vector field

  • action – action on the Lie group

  • method – numerical method in use

Returns:

Jacobian of the system
